jopt.csp.spi.solver
Class ChoicePointDataMap

java.lang.Object
  jopt.csp.spi.solver.ChoicePointDataMap
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChoicePointEntry, java.util.Map
public class ChoicePointDataMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Map, ChoicePointEntry

Map that stores data for an object that needs to record changes in a ChoicePointStack so the changes can be pushed onto the stack and later rolled back when the stack is popped.

Objects that need to act upon the data stored in this map in order to undo the changes recorded in the map need to implement the ChoicePointEntryListener interface. Objects implementing this interface can listen for events that indicate the data in the map is about to be rolled back and should be acted upon.

This class is different from ChoicePointNumArraySet in that it will store any sort of data--any object that is given it. The ChoicePointNumArraySet is similar but only handles certain types of numeric data.

This map wraps internal HashMap and Stack objects that handle performing the functionality required. A new internal HashMap is created whenever a map is pushed on the internal Stack.

This class is not thread safe.

Version:
%I%
Author:
Nick Coleman

push

public void push()
Description copied from interface: ChoicePointEntry

Handles pushing values in the current entry onto an internal stack that can be restored when the pop method is called

This method is more efficient to the pushDelta method and is encouraged for use if delta information is not necessary

Specified by:
push in interface ChoicePointEntry

public void pushDelta(java.lang.Object data)

Specified by:
pushDelta in interface ChoicePointEntry

pop

public void pop()
Description copied from interface: ChoicePointEntry

Restores values in the current entry from data recorded in the internal stack. Any listeners attached to this entry are notified that the values in the entry are about to be rolled back before the action takes place allowing listeners to act accordingly.

This method is more efficient to the popDelta method and is encouraged for use if delta information is not necessary

Specified by:
pop in interface ChoicePointEntry

popDelta

public java.lang.Object popDelta()
Restores values in the current map from data recorded in the internal stack. Any listeners attached to this map are notified that the values in the map are about to be rolled back before the action takes place allowing listeners to act accordingly.

Specified by:
popDelta in interface ChoicePointEntry
Returns:
map of changes that was rolled back in map
